argument.name: UXListName
argument.description: The name of the List Control to navigate.

argument.name: direction
argument.description: The direction to navigate. Can be one of the following values:

item.name: first
item.description: Navigate to the first record in the List.

item.name: previous
item.description: Navigate to the previous record in the List.

item.name: next
item.description: Navigate to the next record in the List.

item.name: last
item.description: Navigate to the last record in the List.

page.description: Navigates by record in the specified direction: first, previous, next, or last.
page.discussion: The *[js:{dialog.object}._listNavigateRecord]* navigates to the next record in the specified direction. In a paginated List control, 'next' will navigate to the next page of records if the last row on the current List page is selected. Similarly, 'previous' will navigate to the previous page of records if the first row in the current List page is selected.
